website_summaries.verdict: This basic bike headset may not be the best of the best, but if you’re on a budget and need something to get the job done, this model from Sunlite may be your best bet.
cons: The paint job on these cheap bike headsets is a little on the thin side, so be careful not to scratch it

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good headset. They only downside is that the bearing cage only holds 16 bearings, which is pretty low compared to what I see looking around, most are 18 - 22 bearings. The bearings are 5/32nd size bearings. Easy to fix this by going loose ball. I had a heck of a time with installation because I didn't know that the cups that insert into the tube are different, I thought they were the same. I accidentally swapped them and it won't work this way. I finally figured it out and got the bottom on the bottom and the top on the top. Works great now.
customer_reviews.author: Pine Needles

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: fit a 1986 GT im redoing and works as expected, it was a little thinner than I wanted but for what it is , its a great value and looks nice on the bike. I'm adding a pic bit i dont have the forks cut yet so the top cap is not mounted yet. The seat rails were black so this headset brought it together , I purchased the bottom bracket in black as well from Amazon from the same maker.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Lackluster finish
customer_reviews.text: The chrome plating is thin and the finish is rough. I got this because I needed a replacement cup for a vintage Fuji I am rebuilding. I salvaged most of the original headset and only used the bottom cup and locknut from this set. The shortcomings are apparent when seen next to the original headset.
customer_reviews.author: nowwatchme

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Had a little work to do, to get it on the forks (new paint job). Threads had to be cleaned but everything was great after the cleanup. Looks great in the wife’s tandem bike.
customer_reviews.author: Greyfox157

customer_reviews.title: You pay for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: I installed it correctly. But there was small play in the neck. I finally took it to Block Bikes in Lancaster,Ca. The professionals replaced the product with a better quality which cost me 40$.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: Works great, don't run a welder through it...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, priced well... recommend not running a TIG welder current through it and destroying the bearings.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McElhineyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: looks good
customer_reviews.text: Nice black coloration without issues in the finish. Pre-lubricated bearings although you probably want to lubricate themselves after shipping. Will have to see about installation as my old headset is stuck.
customer_reviews.author: john peters

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good quality, considering the price. My only complaint is that you cannot adjust this headset with two wrenches as one normally does with this older type of headset. Instead, you adjust the cup by gripping the top cup with your hand and tightening the locknut with a wrench.
customer_reviews.author: DMT

customer_reviews.title: Sunlite Headset-----Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for my vintage rebuild. Fits like it should with no issues!!! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jersey56Ace

customer_reviews.title: A shinny new replacement.
customer_reviews.text: The lower cup was pitted on an old classic and this fit perfectly, works and looks great. Nice price too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: A well made piece of equipment. Fit right and works as advertised
customer_reviews.author: M Wyrick

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. The threaded race locks up the steering if you tighten it to much. Had to use existing threaded race to make the cups and bearings useable. So it would be useless for someone wanting to use all the parts. Avoid if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, good quality material and fine workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Nice set, good quality material and fine workmanship. Very good value. Reasonably light weight for its steel construction. Fine sealing quality too with plastic o rings to help stop the dirt from getting into the bearing surfaces. Easy and no hassle installing on to my older vintage road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Collectorque

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my early 80s Allegro
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my early 80s Allegro. I wish it came with with a couple of washers to give more stack height options, but I can't fault it when it's less than $10.
customer_reviews.author: Sawblade

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work
customer_reviews.text: Didnt fit my huffy stalker bike. Has a 1 inch fork but this is too small to fit into the downtube.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Deal
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed and it is a solid product
customer_reviews.author: jermaine

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Fit was little loose, good thing its for a cheap fixie i have, if not i would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Abreu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for either replacement or new inexpensive build
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice product for the price. Very well finished and solid construction. Bearing quiality seems excellent. Installs easily with a decent seating tool (made mine from threaded rod and PVC pipe fittings). Steering that results is velvety smooth and solid.
customer_reviews.author: DrBob

customer_reviews.title: Nice headset
customer_reviews.text: It fit, Looks great and better quality than the original one on my Giant Sedona, I wanted to "black out" all the silver metal on my bike. This part was cheap and well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: amkrs

customer_reviews.title: replacement part
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 1" threaded headset for a 47 year old frame that no longer has any of its original componets. The original headset was missing a couple of its bearings and the races were pitted. This headset was offered as a package deal with a new fork which the bike also needed. That is how I aquired it. The fact of the matter is though, that because it is steel it is faily smooth and was really easy to install compared to other high-end ones I've done. It isn't top of the line at all. But, for my 47 year old commuter, it'll do.
customer_reviews.author: GLF

customer_reviews.title: Ok cheap headset, but has non-standard, obsolete locknut
customer_reviews.text: This headset works fine, and is a good fit for an older road bike. The problem with it is that it uses very non-standard lock nut, so it's very hard to install properly unless you have the elusive tool for that obsolete lock nut. This lock nut is not the kind you can tighten with a regular headset wrench. I ended up using a bottom bracket tool on this which did not fit right, so I could never tighten the locknut properly. Thus the headset could never be adjusted properly. I suggest that you buy the Ritchey 1 inch headset instead - that's what I'll have to do unfortunately...
customer_reviews.author: gh

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Headset was just what the doctor ordered. Installed easily and adjusted fine. Amazon, why was the package delivered wet?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT take a long time to get it
customer_reviews.text: I would love to rate this headset but im still waiting for it to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: James E Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Sunlite Chrome Steel Threaded Headset
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a companion to a same-brand front fork. If you're doing a fork replacement, it's a good idea to get a matching headset so diameters and threads all fit up. This one worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: No issues so far and seems like good quality
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, it works as advertised. No issues so far and seems like good quality!
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad headset
customer_reviews.text: Quality is good and it fits very well. I build quite a few bikes so I'll be back to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Roly FernandezTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but not original
customer_reviews.text: This really makes old bikes sparkle, but it's not designed to be an original replacement. I would up using the original cups but used everything else in the kit. I'll purchase more as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Fast Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty headset for 21.1 steerer.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking headset. Never got to use it. Bike was taken out in a collision before I could get the old crown races removed.
customer_reviews.author: James Benson

customer_reviews.title: Basic, Utilitarian, Functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent option if you're trying to get a bunch of junk parts assembled into a junk bike, like I was. If you're looking for any smoothness or longevity in your steering, do yourself a favor and upgrade to a reliable brand. However, for what it is, it's not a bad headset. It fit fine and shipped quickly. You will need your own grease for the bearings.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Pope

customer_reviews.title: great for vintage rebuilds
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a cruiser rebuild and it feels just like the old one but better.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas "The Duke" Davis

customer_reviews.title: Just like another reviewer I received a 1 1/8" headset
customer_reviews.text: Just like another reviewer I received a 1 1/8" headset, but I was also expecting a 1" I wasn't able to use it. I'll try to find a friend that can use it, but waste of time and money to even send it back. Will leave a 4 start as it was mailed fast and was new, but description was misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Pullen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement part. It arrived quickly and was exactly as it was advertised. It can be easily modified also.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra J

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty decent, but I wasn't able to use it
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a 1 1/8" headset, but I was expecting a 1". Seems pretty decent, but I wasn't able to use it. I'm keeping it, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: DrDave18

customer_reviews.title: better than high end headset
customer_reviews.text: bought a 1" richey logic and the crown would press on my fork and i spent 20 on that one so i i figured i would go cheap and the crown from this one pressed on perfect and and cant really tell it was cheap its just a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Leaving a rating is about warning or advising others on the product . It is very good part , it is ok .
customer_reviews.author: Ervad

product_meta.title: SUNLITE Threaded Headset
product_meta.description: Sunlite Threaded Headsets in different size and color variations

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
